name: Base Party Hostel 18-35 Years Old Only
detail: Greatly done pool party’s day trips and nightly activity’s.

name: COSI Krabi Ao Nang Beach
detail: As a solo traveler, I always choose a budget hotel to rest my head, I never write any review before but this hotel made me to! Room is clean and decor with good quality. Great design for user experience, for example There are 3 plugs and 5 usb sockets! Definitely suggest this hotel for someone energetic who seek to spent time on activities.

name: B2 Krabi Premier Hotel
detail: Nap Krabi Hotel has everything needed for a wonderful Thailand holiday. The rooms are of a high standard, air-conditioning perfect and security good. Pool was refreshing and always clean. Only one grumble about the room was the bedside lights were too dim to read by. We liked the convenience of the location; shops, airport and Krabi all within easy distance. The hotel provides free rides to most places you need to visit. We relied for the hotel restaurant for most of our meals. which were tasty, not too spicy and had a good variety. Taking everything into account, I am so glad we chose Nap Krabi Hotel for our Thailand holiday.

name: Railay Princess Resort & Spa
detail: Writing this my the roof top pool, looking out at the sea. Don't really write reviews but after a bad start in thailand and this place been a slice of luxury, I felt I owe it to others to write a review. I had a bad start in a hotel a few hotels down, which was not clean and small pool, I then moved to the princeas for only £6 more and it is like a different world. Cold towel and juice on arrival, friendly staff and a bell not to carry your bags. Big room, lovely clean modern bathroom, balcony and free water tea and coffee. 2 swimming pools, one on the roof, free towels, pool side service,mini mart and beautiful restaurant, massive buffet breakfast and free wifi in all areas of the hotel. The staff are really friendly and helpful. On the east side so a short safe walk to the more busy bars and then 10 min walk to the west and sunset beach. Lots of places to eat cheaply and well near buy and lots of places to book tours, found last bar the best and cheapest prices for this. Love this hotel and can't recommend enough !!

name: Anana Ecological Resort Krabi
detail: I would say Anana has provided a quality service to me and my girlfriend, the environment was chill and nice (except the shuttle bus was very limited) but getting tutu to the Ao Nang Beach is around 200 baht. The service at Anana was up to point and I would like to especially thank Rut and Ree for their service, with their warm greetings and helpful advice I had a great time at Krabi, e.g. they will tell us where is the best place to get local food and they would call tutu and communicate with the driver for us. We had a great experience at Anana for 6 days.

name: BlueSotel SMART Krabi Aonang Beach - Adults only
detail: Amazing hotel with great rooftop pool, super clean and extremely comfortable rooms, delicious breakfasts. The staff is amazing in both Blue Sotel Smart and Blue Sotel Krabi- thank you for heloping me get to the right hotel. I truly enjoyed my stay there. It is the best hitel I have ever visited. Also, the staff follows highest standards, everyone is kind and helpful! They also helped me with my cancelled flight. purely amazing, immaculate, I highly recommend!

name: Blanco Hideout Railay - Youth Hostel 18 to 35 Only
detail: Stayed here for 2 nights in August over off season and was still quite busy. Dorm rooms are like converted villas; clean and well air conditioned. The overall hostel is a great experience with amazing views over Krabi and would definitely recommend staying as a solo traveller.

name: The Lai Thai Luxury Condominiums
detail: We visited Ao Nang for 11 days with our two teenagers, 6 year old, and 1.5 year old at the end of a 6 week holiday to Thailand. The Lai Thai provided exactly what we needed at that point: space. The 3 bedroom penthouse was spotless, well furnished, and had everything we needed (including a baby cot). From the master bedroom you could see the sunrise behind the limestone cliffs... beautiful. The location was good in terms of Ao Nang accommodations, since there are very few properties directly on the beach (which we would have preferred). With the little kids, it was about a 15 minute walk down to the water (0.8 km), or a 1 minute tuk tuk ride. It's right on the main strip near the shops and restaurants, and there was a small grocery store nearby which was great. For the teens: The downside for them was that the pool wasn't deep enough (it doesn't go deeper then chest level, although it's very large). They loved the gym, the fact that they had a washroom attached to their (own) bedroom, the large balcony, and the separate living space. They also loved having the 7-eleven directly across the street and the proximity to everything. For the little kids: In terms of Thailand standard, The Lai Thai is very safe (eg, there are railings that the kids won't fall through, the balconies are completely safe, etc.). There is a great wading pool (although the steps going in are quite slippery), a large bathtub in the master bedroom, a baby cot (upon request), and the lady in the restaurant made sure they didn't go hungry! :) It was also nice having a kitchen and dining room table so we didn't have to eat out all the time. Babysitting is available if needed. The staff was fantastic! The housekeepers, the lady at the restaurant, and everyone at the reception desk, especially the main lady, were great! Overall, we all loved our stay.

name: Aonang Dugong
detail: The hotel offers great family room and is in great location

name: BlueSotel Krabi
detail: I would given a 5 star if the TV is working (though Hotel Staffs explain the fault is at the service provider). My room is facing an under-construction building but does not really bother; we spend the days on snorkeling / island hopping and around Krabi. Hotel staffs are friendly and polite throughout my stay. Halal restaurant is within reach. Hotel is located somewhere it is easy access to Aonang beach and Muslim street, eitherway is 10mins walk. I will definitely return to Bluesotel if i visit Krabi in future.
